ARABIC: لِّنُحْۦِىَ بِهِۦ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُۥ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَآ أَنْعَٰمًا وَأَنَاسِىَّ كَثِيرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: so that by it We can bring a dead land to life and give drink to many of the animals and people We created.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: To quicken a region that was dead, and to give it as drink to animals We have created and to men in plenty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: so that He may revive the dead land, and quench the thirst of many of His creatures from among beasts and men.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: to revive the barren land and provide water for many creatures, cattle, and people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In order that We may revive a dead city with it, and give it to the many beasts and men that We have created, to drink.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give to drink thereof many of the cattle and men that We have created.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: That We may give life thereby to a dead land and give it for drink, out of what We have created, to cattle and many people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: so that We might revive a dead land, and give to drink of it, of that We created, cattle and men a many.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give many beasts and men that We have created to drink thereof.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: so that We may bring life to a dead land; and slake the thirst of Our creation; cattle and men, in great numbers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: That We may quicken thereby a dead land, and We give drink thereof to that which We have created of cattle and human beings many.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: with which We revive a dead country and provide water to many of the cattle and humans We have created.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That with it We may give life to a dead land, and slake the thirst of things We have created,- cattle and men in great numbers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give to drink thereof many of the cattle and men that We had created.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: so, that with it We revive dead lands and provide drink for the cattle and the human We created.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: To revive dead lands thereby, and to provide drink for the multitude of animals and humans We created.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:49]   with which We revive a dead land (read maytan, in the softened form, equally valid for the masculine and the feminine, but in the masculine [here] because of the [masculine] noun indicating ‘place’ [implicit therein]) and We give it, the water, as drink to the many cattle, camels, cows and sheep, and humans We have created (anāsiyy is the plural of insān: properly it [the plural] should be anāsīn but the [final] nūn has been replaced with a yā’, with which the [other] yā’ has been assimilated; or it [anāsiyy] is [simply] the plural of insiyy).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (That We may give life thereby to a dead land) a land that has no vegetation, (and We give many beasts and men that We have created to drink thereof.
